resources.string: Quadros is a memory matrix game that tests your ability to recall spatial layouts and trains your brain. Try to complete each level of the game by tapping on tiles to repeat a pattern temporarily shown on the screen. As you progress, the number of tiles to remember increases and the matrix gets bigger. Win points for correct answers and lose 1 heart for incorrect guesses; every game starts with 4 hearts. Try to get the highest score possible!
Easy: Start with 4 hearts at the beginning of every level.
Medium: Regenerate a heart if you complete a level without mistakes (maximum 4 hearts).
Hard: No heart regeneration. You only get 4 chances for the entire game!
Quadros was created by Jerome Martinez, Tiffany Ko, and QuocViet Le for Michael Scotts Mobile Computing course (Fall 2012) at the University of Texas at Austin.
